macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Briefly Tops 7,000 Milestone Amid Tech Rally
items.summary: The S&P 500 surpassed the 7,000 level for the first time intraday, gaining over 0.4%, led by technology stocks. The index has been testing resistance around 6,980 as investors position ahead of major tech earnings reports.

items.title: Nasdaq Leads Market Gains; Semiconductor Stocks Surge
items.summary: The Nasdaq advanced 0.59% with semiconductor companies driving gains, including Intel (+9.43%), Texas Instruments (+8.46%), and Micron (+5.52%). Megacap tech stocks remained more restrained ahead of earnings announcements.

items.title: Major Tech Earnings Expected; Fed Decision Looms
items.summary: Highly anticipated earnings reports from Microsoft, Meta, and Tesla are expected after market close, while the Federal Reserve interest rate decision and key housing and energy data releases are scheduled for later in the day.

items.title: Dollar Weakness Supports Precious Metals and Risk Assets
items.summary: Global markets are experiencing record-breaking safe-haven flows alongside resilient risk appetite, with a plunging dollar supporting surging precious metals prices.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Analysis for January 28 - BTC Up 2.19% in 24 Hours
items.summary: Bitcoin has risen 2.19% over the last 24 hours and is trading near $89,876. Technical analysts expect potential movement toward $90,000-$93,000 if resistance levels are broken, with sideways trading in the $88,000-$92,000 range considered the most likely scenario.

items.title: Bitcoin Forecast Shows Mixed Signals - Potential Test of $90,065 Resistance
items.summary: Bitcoin is trading within a descending channel with moving averages indicating a short-term bearish trend. Analysts expect a test of the $90,065 resistance level with potential decline targets below $80,405, though a breakout above $92,505 would signal continued upward movement toward $98,605.

items.title: Bitcoin Futures Show Firmer Trading - Bulls Work to Stabilize Price
items.summary: February bitcoin futures prices are trading firmer in early trading, with bulls attempting to stabilize the cryptocurrency's price amid ongoing market volatility.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI That Talks to Itself Learns Faster and Smarter
items.summary: Researchers at Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology demonstrate that AI systems using internal 'mumbling' and short-term memory adapt to new tasks more efficiently with less training data. This approach enhances flexibility and could lead to more human-like AI.

items.title: Enamine and Chemspace Join LIGAND-AI Project for AI-Driven Drug Discovery
items.summary: Enamine and Chemspace partner in the Innovative Health Initiative's LIGAND-AI project, generating massive open datasets of protein-ligand interactions to train AI models predicting drug candidates for thousands of human proteins. The initiative promotes open science and aims to accelerate early drug discovery.

items.title: Biggest AI Bottleneck Isn't GPUs—It's Data Resilience
items.summary: Experts highlight data resilience as the critical challenge for scaling AI, with poor data governance creating trust issues and cybersecurity risks in agentic AI deployments. Only 6% of organizations report fully AI-ready data infrastructure.

items.title: Warning: AI Autoscaling Vulnerable to Adversarial Attacks
items.summary: AI-driven cloud autoscaling using transformers and graph neural networks risks exploitation by attackers gaming models to cause excessive costs or downtime, introducing new adversarial machine learning threats.

items.title: Rochester Tech Leaders Predict AI Boom in Mission-Critical Applications for 2026
items.summary: Leaders from L3Harris and Wilmac Technologies emphasize AI's role in speeding data synthesis for defense and launching Continuity WFM, an AI workforce management tool for 911 centers, as key trends driving innovation.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: EA Sports FC 27 May Feature Open World Mode
items.summary: Closed testing of an open world mode for EA Sports FC is underway, with reports suggesting it could be added to the series as early as next year following a secret presentation.

items.title: Highguard Devs Announce Year-Long Content Plan After Poor Launch
items.summary: Despite a terrible release, Wildlight Entertainment has revealed a grand battle plan with new content for the free shooter Highguard, expected to last all year to appreciate players.

items.title: 155.io Launches CCTV.Game Genre with Rush Hour
items.summary: 155.io has debuted CCTV.Game, a new genre using live CCTV footage worldwide, starting with Rush Hour, a 24/7 live game turning real-world traffic into bettable entertainment.

items.title: Coyote Time Publishing Launches as New Global Indie Publisher
items.summary: Finland-based Coyote Time Publishing has launched with the goal of elevating small indie studios to global recognition.

items.title: Ubisoft Unions Call for International Strike in February
items.summary: Five French unions at Ubisoft are proposing a mass walkout next month over cost-cutting measures and a return-to-office mandate.

items.title: NetEase Games Lays Off Staff in Montreal
items.summary: NetEase Games has conducted layoffs at its Montreal teams, continuing the trend of job cuts across the video game industry.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Advantest Ramps Up AI Chip Testing Capacity Amid Surging Demand
items.summary: Advantest is accelerating production of semiconductor test equipment to meet rising demand from hyperscalers and chipmakers for validating high-performance chips. This expansion highlights testing as a key bottleneck in the chip supply chain.

items.title: China Approves Nvidia H200 Imports for ByteDance, Alibaba, and Tencent
items.summary: China has cleared major tech firms to purchase large volumes of Nvidia's H200 AI chips, easing access to advanced hardware for model training and inference. The move balances domestic semiconductor goals with AI competitiveness.

items.title: SoftBank in Talks for $30B Additional Investment in OpenAI
items.summary: SoftBank is negotiating to invest up to $30 billion more in OpenAI as part of a massive capital raise resembling infrastructure financing. This underscores the shift toward sustained investments in compute and data centers.

items.title: Broadcom Reports AI Driving Over Half of Semiconductor Revenue
items.summary: Broadcom stated that AI contributed more than 50% of its semiconductor revenues, with over $10 billion in AI rack orders secured. This signals strong, sustained hyperscaler demand ahead of Big Tech earnings.

items.title: Tech Industry Office Demand Leads National Growth in 2025
items.summary: Amid a major AI boom, tech sector office demand became the primary driver of U.S. office market growth in 2025, insulating key markets like San Francisco and New York from broader declines.
